official-title.#text:
To require Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to disclose the
		  minimum purchase price that such an enterprise will accept on the short sale of
		  a residence financed by a mortgage purchased by such an enterprise in order to
		  make short sales a viable alternative to foreclosure.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 in any case in which such

denies the purchase of a
			 residential mortgage loan made to finance the purchase, under a short sale, of
			 a covered dwelling on the basis that the purchase price involved in the short
			 sale is insufficient, to promptly disclose to the prospective seller of the
			 covered dwelling the amount by which such purchase price was less than the
			 minimum purchase price sufficient for such

to
			 approve purchase of such mortgage.

text.#text:
For
			 purposes of this section, the following definitions shall apply:

quote.#tail:
means, with respect to a
			 residential mortgage loan on a covered dwelling, a purchase of the dwelling
			 that will result in proceeds in an amount that is less than the remaining
			 amount due under the residential mortgage loan on the covered dwelling.

means a
			 residential real property that—

text.#text:
consists of from
			 one to four dwelling units; and

is subject to a
			 mortgage, deed or trust, or other security interest that secures a residential
			 mortgage loan on which the mortgagor is delinquent on payments due under the
			 mortgage loan.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 1335 IH: Short Sale Transparency Act of 2013
